text: What css file is that for?
Looking for help, any reason i am getting og:tags with placeholders in from the standard_header_includes?
view-source:<https://www.eplace.com.au/property/QLD-Newstead-R2-376733>
These are dynamic pages from HUBDB
You can even see the stupid "make this dynamic via javscript" coming through in the includes
The advice from support is to add them myself outside of this standard_header_includes and that nothing can be done about the duplication.
I am sitting here genuinely thinking WTF, that cannot be right?!
<@U6GNQ7JBU> any insight on this one?
That css file is referenced as the template stylesheet
Nope, not developing locally.  This site belongs to a new client, and I'm just trying to wrap my head around it currently
sounds odd. my guess is whoever built the site originally built it using scss locally and they went and uploaded all of that to HubSpot even though HS doesn’t support scss
What does it say in hubdb for the entires? MAKE THIS DYNAMIC VIA JAVASCRIPT?
I'm trying to understand what you have setup, what you have in place, and what it should be
I think it's something else.  None of the .scss files are in HubSpot

I have a feeling it's compiling .scss from somewhere else and then injecting it into the .css file in HubSpot via the API.  If that is in fact the case, it's super cool and I want to figure out how to do it
agreed, let us know if you figure it out, would love to know that little “hack”
The title gets automatically populated from the hs_title column of the table, but there currently isn’t a way to override the description
if you leave the default description blank, will it pick up your duplicate one later?
or you could just change your template to include your overridden tags before standard_header_includes

Hi Everyone, I’m looking for some insight on customizing the property cards within a deal using the CRM Extensions API (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview>). I am looking to be able to add a custom card to the side bar inside of a deal. Inside the custom card would be deal properties that already exist in other cards. After looking through some of the documentation it seems possible but is still a little over my head. Let me know if this needs more clarification but any info would be much appreciated!
Something in HubSpot is populating the default one, so it isn't left blank.
I could move them yes, but prefer HubSpot to actually work correctly...
is it possibly to use a changing link for a CTA, i want to use the same CTA definition, but have upwards of 1000 possible URL's it can goto. Thanks!
The hubdb has a hs_name and hs_path + my custom fields
That text isnt in HubDB anywhere
Do I need a column for META description?
to allow this, there would either have to way to designate a specific hubdb column as the description source, or add another built-in column like hs_title.

Yes you can do that anthony, but it will require some coding skills or using an external service.

On HubSpot this could be done by creating a hubDB(for storing all of the possible link options that the cta could send someone to)

Then you create a page, using a new custom coded template, use HubL to pick a random url from the hubDB and force a redirect(if hubl supports that) if not then use a meta redirect <https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/H76.html>. try to make sure to strip everything out of the page except that meta tag to improve load time.
Do you think that would make the CTA reports track CTA usage by page?
What I am hoping for is the reason why some random misspelt text is being output on a web page? Am I missing something or is this out of my control?
